item.title: Three Category I Experts in Public Administration Reform, HR Management in Civil Service and Civil Service Reform
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Advisory Support to Ukraine’s Public Administration Reform Implementation

Global objective

To improve accountability, quality, effectiveness and efficiency of the Ukrainian public administration on the basis of Ukraine’s Strategy of Public Administration Reform and its Implementation Plan.

Specific objectives:

To assist the Government of Ukraine in the process of launching the PAR Strategy, including establishment of relevant strategic framework, coordination structures and monitoring mechanism; To assist the Government in initial implementation of specific actions of the PAR Strategy through coaching and provision of conceptual, methodological and operational guidance based on the principles of public administration and best European practices. This shall cover reorganization of public administration, policy making reform and civil service reform.

Three Category I Experts in Public Administration Reform, HR Management in Civil Service and Civil Service Reform

Qualifications and skills:

  • Master degree in a field related to the assignment (law, public administration, management, economy) or equivalent professional experience (7 years of experience in public sector); Excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written;
  • Knowledge of Ukrainian (or Russian) will be an asset.

General professional experience

  • a minimum of 12 years experience in civil service or public sector following the award of the above required Master degree;

Specific professional experience: At least 8 years of specific and practical experience (following the award of the above required Master degree) in the fields related to the assignment:

  • Expert I: design and implementation of large scale public administration reforms, including overall coordination of PAR process, reorganisation of public administration, policy making reform
  • Expert II: HR management in civil service, civil service reform, including reform of salary system and design of relevant information management systems;
  • Expert III: design and implementation of large scale public administration reforms, including reorganisation of public administration, cost analysis of PAR

As part of 8 years of experience required above, at least 3 years of experience at senior level in the EU Member State’s administration or in the administration of an accession country in the fields related to the assignment.

While analysing specific professional experience, a particular attention will be paid to the following issues:

Expert 1

  • practical experience in the area of PAR at strategic level;
  • experience in drafting I implementing large scale reforms of public sector or I and public administration;
  • experience of preparing policy and legal assessments, comparative analysis in the area of PAR;
  • experience in facilitating high level policy dialogue in the area of PAR.

Expert 2

  • practical experience in the area of civil service reform at strategic level;
  • experience in drafting I implementing civil service reform, including drafting legal,policy (conceptual) and methodological documents;
  • experience in designing I implementing large scale IT projects related to HRM in civil service;
  • knowledge of European principles of public administration with a particular focus on civil service.

Expert 3

  • practical experience in the area of PAR at strategic level;
  • experience in drafting I implementing large scale reforms of public sector or /and public administration;
  • experience in carrying out cost analysis of PAR and its main components
  • experience in facilitating high level policy dialogue in the area of reorganisation of public administration;
  • experience in carrying out functional review of public bodies;

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

item.title: Evaluation Experts with experience of Implementation Procedures of the ENI or IPA II AND CIR
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Review Evaluations of ENI and IPA

The Instrument for Pre-accession assistance (IPA II) and European Neighbourhood Policy (ENI) evaluations, together with the other independent evaluations of each External Financing Instrument (EFI) and the Coherence Report, will be some of the sources of information to feed into the Mid Term Review Report (MTR) of the EFIs. The MTR is required by the Common Implementing Regulation (CIR) Article 17, by end December 2017.

Evaluation Experts with experience of Implementation Procedures of the ENI or IPA II AND CIR

We are seeking separate teams for the two evaluations, but the profiles are both as follows:

  • Working knowledge of EU external action policies, and the implementation modalities
  • Working knowledge of the international aid and development effectiveness agenda and principles and of the EU enlargement policy, and also have good knowledge of cross cutting issues, especially gender mainstreaming
  • EU external co-operation policy and development policy of Member States, and their aid modalities
  • Implementation procedures of the ENI or IPA II AND CIR
  • Compliance checking in the area of policy implementation
  • Evaluation methods and techniques in general and, preferably, of evaluation in the field of external relations and development cooperation; in particular the team needs to demonstrate experience in analytical methods which can evaluate change, and which can evaluate contribution
  • Quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis
  • For IPA and ENI The evaluation team should have an excellent command of English – both spoken and written – and the ability to function at a high level in French
  • For ENI- team members should also have good understanding of Arabic or Russian

item.title: Experts for bid: Ukraine Financial Sector Transformation Activity
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Ukraine Financial Sector Transformation (FST) Activity is a four-year effort, estimated to start in summer 2016, that aims to transform and stabilize Ukraine’s financial sector, with an emphasis on: increasing public confidence in and understanding of the banking system, improving the non-bank financial sector regulatory environment, increasing access to finance for SMEs, bolstering financial inclusion, expanding digital finance solutions, and supporting the growth of a balanced and sustainable pension system.

DAI seeks experts available for short-term assignments to support a donor-funded financial sector strengthening project in Ukraine in the following areas:

  • Financial literacy/consumer protection
  • Financial reporting standards/IFRS/XBRL
  • Pension reform (around Pillars II and III in particular)
  • Energy market trading
  • Reform experience with securities/stock market regulators
  • Payment systems /digital financial services
  • Commodity market reform
  • Compliance with EU Directives related to the EU Association Agreement and the Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement (DCFTA)
  • Compliance/legal and regulatory experience with IOSCO standards

This is a USAID-funded project but the expertise and skills required are closely aligned to those required for EC BENEF Lot 10.

item.title: Junior Expert in Gender and Development with experience in Maldives
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Sri Lanka and The Maldives Gender Analysis and GAP II Planning

Global objective

The gender analysis will provide an understanding on the various types/categories of gender inequalities that persist in Sri Lanka and the Maldives and its causes, including how it intersects with other inequalities, how it impacts on human rights enjoyment and on the benefits produced by development efforts. Further, the analysis will provide an in-depth view of the Governments commitments as reflected in the current legislations and their limitations, if any, and the capacity to work on GEWE issues.

Specific objective

The gender analysis should provide quantitative and qualitative information, sex-age disaggregated data and analysis on the gender situation in the countries in order for the EU Delegation and EU Member States to contribute to the policy dialogue and facilitate the formulation of gender-sensitive strategies and programmes.

Junior Expert in Gender and Development with experience in Maldives – (5 working days)

item.title: Spécialiste Senior de l’environnement
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
*Assistance technique a l'ordonnateur regional pour la programmation du 11eme FED des PTOM de la region Pacifique * La mission principale sera d’assister la Nouvelle-Calédonie en tant qu’OR à l’élaboration du projet de Document de Programmation, ainsi que la signature de la convention de financement. Cette tâche sera effectuée avec la collaboration de toutes les parties impliquées dans la préparation du Document de Programmation et dans le respect des principes et procédures du 11° FED prévus dans la DAO et dans les instructions de programmation.

Objectif global L’objectif principal de la mission est de fournir une assistance technique à la Nouvelle Calédonie en tant qu’OR lors de la phase de préparation des documents prévus pour la programmation des ressources allouées aux PTOM du Pacifique au titre du 11ème FED (enveloppe régionale) ; il s’agit en particulier de la préparation, de l’élaboration et de la rédaction du document de programmation jusqu’à son approbation formelle par les services de la Commission européenne, et de la convention de financement afférente Le programme régional du Pacifique devra prendre en compte l’impact régional des interventions, les études et lorsque cela est pertinent les projets qui sont ou seront mis en oeuvre dans ce contexte.

Objectifs spécifiques Objectif 1 : Faciliter la définition et formuler des recommandations pour la programmation, la conception, la gestion, la mise en oeuvre, le suivi et l’évaluation du programme régional, dans le cadre du 11ème FED Objectif 2 : Faciliter l’organisation des consultations nécessaires dans le cadre du « comité régional de pilotage de la programmation » (CRPP), et avec les pays du groupe ACP du Pacifique et les organisations régionales mandatées (« Duly Mandated Regional Organisations »), tout au long du processus de programmation et en particulier dans le cadre du montage du programme (en préparation des résultats attendus dans la section 2.4). Objectif 3 : Produire et garantir la qualité et la conformité de l’ensemble des composantes du document de programmation du 11ème FED régional PTOM - Océan Pacifique (partie A, Document d'Action lors de la phase d'identification, partie B – Document d'Action lors de la phase de formulation), y inclus ses annexes, au regard de la règlementation européenne applicable. Objectif 4 : Produire et garantir la qualité et la conformité du projet de la convention de financement du 11ème FED entre l’Union européenne et la Nouvelle Calédonie en tant qu’OR concernant le programme régional, y inclus ses annexes (et notamment).

Project Location: Nouvelle-Calédonie, Wallis et Futuna et Polynésie Française, Nouvelle Zélande, Fidji

Spécialiste de l’environnement

Formation: Niveau Master en environnement, sciences de l’environnement ou droit de l’environnement.

Experience: Prérequis :

  • Au minimum 12 années d’expérience dans le domaine des politiques publiques en matière d’environnement et du changement climatique
  • Connaissances et expériences dans le domaine de l’environnement et la gestion des ressources naturelles, le changement climatique et la prévention des risques de catastrophes naturelles
  • Si possible connaissance du contexte naturel, culturel et politique des PTOM européens du Pacifique et de l'environnement socio-culturel océanien
  • Connaissance des outils informatiques
  • Aptitude à évaluer la capacité institutionnelle des institutions impliquées dans la mise en oeuvre de programmes de développement

Langue: *Exigée *:

  • Parfait maîtrise du français, lu, écrit et parlé. La langue de cette mission est le français
  • Bonne connaissance de la langue anglaise lu, écrite et parlée

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to corinamaria_campian@dai.com
